channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: ICE is deporting some immigrants so quickly, their attorneys are left scrambling
item.description: Immigrants who are detained by ICE often get deported out of state so quickly that their attorneys don't have time to file petitions to keep them in the state where they were arrested.
item.content:encoded: Immigrants who are detained by ICE often get deported out of state so quickly that their attorneys don't have time to file petitions to keep them in the state where they were arrested.
item.dc:creator: Beenish Ahmed

item.title: Ranchers test virtual fence technology's ability to keep cows safe from grizzly bears
item.description: Technology enabling virtual fences for pets is now being adapted for livestock. Ranchers near Yellowstone National Park are testing its ability to keep cows safe from grizzly bear attacks.
item.content:encoded: Technology enabling virtual fences for pets is now being adapted for livestock. Ranchers near Yellowstone National Park are testing its ability to keep cows safe from grizzly bear attacks.
item.dc:creator: Hanna Merzbach

item.title: Operation Match: How the first computerized dating service came to be
item.description: Back in the 1960s, a couple of Harvard students had an idea. From Radio Diaries, this is a look back at the creation of the very first computerized dating service.
item.content:encoded: Back in the 1960s, a couple of Harvard students had an idea. From Radio Diaries, this is a look back at the creation of the very first computerized dating service.
item.dc:creator: Radio Diaries

item.title: Criminal justice experts explain why crime rates fell in 2025
item.description: Crime rates in the U.S. fell in 2025. Murders in particular fell dramatically. That is a major takeaway among criminal justice experts as we approach the year's end.
item.content:encoded: Crime rates in the U.S. fell in 2025. Murders in particular fell dramatically. That is a major takeaway among criminal justice experts as we approach the year's end.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: Marijuana rescheduling would bring some immediate changes, but others will take time
item.description: President Trump set the process in motion to ease federal restrictions on marijuana. But his order doesn't automatically revoke laws targeting marijuana, which remains illegal to transport over state lines.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump set the process in motion to ease federal restrictions on marijuana. But his order doesn't automatically revoke laws targeting marijuana, which remains illegal to transport over state lines.

(Image credit: Charlie Riedel)
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: The cultural works becoming public domain in 2026, from Betty Boop to Nancy Drew
item.description: The original Betty Boop, the first four Nancy Drew books and Greta Garbo's first talkie are among the many works from 1930 that will be free to use, share and remake starting on Jan. 1.
item.content:encoded: The original Betty Boop, the first four Nancy Drew books and Greta Garbo's first talkie are among the many works from 1930 that will be free to use, share and remake starting on Jan. 1.
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Why do airline computer systems fail? What the industry can learn from meltdowns
item.description: Alaska Airlines is the latest airline to ground its planes because of an IT meltdown. We talked to industry leaders about why these systems fail, and what airlines can learn from past disruptions.
item.content:encoded:
Alaska Airlines is the latest airline to ground its planes because of an IT meltdown. We talked to industry leaders about why these systems fail, and what airlines can learn from past disruptions.

(Image credit: Stephen Brashear)
item.dc:creator: Joel Rose

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump announces U.S. strikes against ISIS targets in Nigeria, a look back at Congress' tumultuous year, holiday spending is expected to be strong despite low consumer confidence.
item.content:encoded: Trump announces U.S. strikes against ISIS targets in Nigeria, a look back at Congress' tumultuous year, holiday spending is expected to be strong despite low consumer confidence.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: More rain expected in Southern California after flooding, mudslides batter region
item.description: Heavy rain is expected to return to Southern California Friday after flash flooding, power outages and mudslides pummeled the region during the week.
item.content:encoded: Heavy rain is expected to return to Southern California Friday after flash flooding, power outages and mudslides pummeled the region during the week.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Iowa man goes against the grain to move back home and run his family's farm
item.description: Although many people who live in rural areas and small towns leave for big cities, a man in western Iowa bucked the trend, returning home -- house and all -- to take over his family's farm.
item.content:encoded: Although many people who live in rural areas and small towns leave for big cities, a man in western Iowa bucked the trend, returning home -- house and all -- to take over his family's farm.
item.dc:creator: Sheila Brummer
